page.title: 01Landscape:Cornwood
page.content: Three quarters of this block is Dartmoor National Parkland.It consists of fields,moorland and temperate woodland.The{fields}around the moorland are rough grazing and those lower down are larger and intensively managed grassland.The{moorland}is part of the{Forest of Dartmoor}but unconnected to the main moor.It offers excellent views in all directions. The {woodland}is in the main,natural but there is a small amount of Forestry Commission planting. Two fast flowing {rivers,}the Erme and the Yealm run from north to south. The block contains the village of{Cornwood}and the hamlet of{Harford.}There are also scattered farms. Of the few{roads,}one is a B-road over 4m wide,the rest being minor B-roads or tracks. It is a peaceful,attractive area with a good selection of flora and fauna.
